The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Pouzolzia zeylanica is characterized by its fibrous root system and its ability to thrive in wetland habitats.
